snippet: The investment firm has agreed to buy control of 80 apartment complexes from General Electric, valuing the properties at about $2.7 billion, a person briefed on the matter said on Monday.
abstract: The investment firm has agreed to buy control of 80 apartment complexes from General Electric, valuing the properties at about $2.7 billion, a person briefed on the matter said on Monday.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

headline.main: Blackstone Is Said to Buy Apartments From G.E.
